title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [3 april 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [3 April 1873]
text: Spring of 1873walter deari got your letter to day and lilliesLillie's and the graphic i wrote you a long letter on tuesdayTuesday did you get it walterWalter when you write say if you got it it was the 1 of aprilApril i wrote if you write to prissellaPriscilla or lillieLillie or aunt sally her name is aunt sally mead aunt phoebe was named pintard she is dead years ago aunt sally is the only one left out of 8 sisters) priscillaPriscilla has a sister named maggyMaggy trip you saw her to our house you must send your love to her also when you write i wish you would write to them walterWalter this is my last envelopewalt did you ever hear of the galvanic battery for panalasisparalasis some thinks its very beneficial waltWalt you say sometimes you are writing at your desk well i am writing this down stairs all alone i have been on my feet all day and now i can hardly walk i cooked the dinner and made a pies and made some cake i was very tired when i washed the dinner dshesdishes) Lou and her aunt is up stairs waiting for the doctor to come) i am amused sometimes and sometimes i feel mad for instance this morning her aunt took up her breakfast on a waiter while i fried indianIndian cakes and in a few minutes louLou was down stairs â€”sometimes georgeGeorge carries her up) its seems so different from what i have always had to go through) i should like to go to greenportGreenport if i can this summer i wrote to maryMary i though maybeemaybe i would come but i haventhaven't had a word from her since maybeemaybe she didentdidn't get my letter) write as often as you can walterWalter dear and say if you got my letter of tuesdayTuesdayaprilApril i wrote Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [3 April 1873]
